designScenario.name: Air Supply System
designScenario.description: The Air Supply System (ASS) is a critical subsystem of the Environmental Control System (ECS) responsible for sourcing, conditioning, and distributing breathable air to the aircraft cabin. It integrates bleed air extraction from engines/APU, filtration, temperature preconditioning, and pressure regulation to ensure a continuous supply of air meeting aviation safety standards. The system maintains cabin pressurization, oxygen levels, and air circulation while coordinating with fire suppression and emergency oxygen systems.

details.description: The system shall regulate airflow between 800-2500 CFM based on cabin occupancy and flight phase using variable-frequency fan drives.
Maintain cabin pressure altitude below 8,000 ft (0.75-1.1 atm) during all flight phases using outflow valve control.
Provide dual redundant air sources (engine bleed/APU/electric compressor) with automatic failover within 3 seconds of pressure loss.
Remove 99.97% of airborne particulates ≥0.3 microns using HEPA filters with differential pressure monitoring.
Maintain cabin pressure during rapid decompression events with <15 second recovery to safe levels (≤15,000 ft equivalent).
Provide touchscreen controls with synoptic displays showing airflow rates, filter status, and pressure differentials.
Design all components as LRUs (Line Replaceable Units) with <30 minute MTTR (Mean Time To Repair).

systemComponents.name: Air Supply Management Unit
systemComponents.description: Central controller managing air source selection, flow distribution, and interface with ECS

subComponents.name: Bleed Air Controller
subComponents.description: Regulates engine/APU bleed air extraction pressures

subComponents.name: Flow Distribution Module
subComponents.description: Directs air to cabin zones via electrically actuated valves

systemComponents.name: Bleed Air System
systemComponents.description: High-pressure air extraction and preconditioning system

subComponents.name: Bleed Air Valve
subComponents.description: Modulating valve controlling bleed air extraction rate

subComponents.name: Pre-Cooler
subComponents.description: Air-to-air heat exchanger reducing bleed air temperature

subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator
subComponents.description: Reduces bleed air pressure to cabin service levels

systemComponents.name: Cabin Air Distribution Network
systemComponents.description: Ducting and nozzles for optimized air distribution

subComponents.name: Primary Distribution Ducts
subComponents.description: Aluminum alloy ducts with acoustic lining

systemComponents.name: Air Filtration Unit
systemComponents.description: Particulate and gaseous contaminant removal system

systemComponents.name: Redundant Air Supply Unit
systemComponents.description: Emergency air compression and delivery system

subComponents.name: Isolation Valves
subComponents.description: Prevent reverse flow during emergency operation

relationships.description: The management unit aggregates and controls bleed air system components
Depends on engine compressor bleed ports for air source
Exchanges pressure data and valve position feedback
Network is physically composed of primary distribution ducts
Managed as part of the overall air supply control strategy
Supplies filtered air to the distribution network

attributes.name: airflowCapacity
attributes.description: Adjustable airflow rate based on cabin occupancy and flight phase

attributes.name: pressureRange
attributes.description: Operational cabin pressure range from sea level to 8,000 ft equivalent

attributes.name: filtrationEfficiency
attributes.description: HEPA filtration performance for particulate removal

attributes.name: redundancyLevel
attributes.description: Fail-operational architecture for critical air supply components

attributes.name: responseTime
attributes.description: Maximum allowable delay for redundancy activation

comments.body: Maintains cabin pressure between 10.9-11.9 PSI during all flight phases
